intro: Micromeria hyssopifolia, commonly known as silverleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy, often silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, five-petaled blue or violet flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Micromeria hyssopifolia is often found in coastal sage scrub and chaparral habitats.
